definition: to transfer (school)
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
school/military officer/CL:所[suo3]
to proofread/to check/to compare

sentences.english: The mother of the 4-year-old boy said she is considering transferring her son to another school.
sentences.chinese: 4岁男孩的母亲说，她正在考虑给儿子转校。

sentences.english: Was it hard to adjust to this school as a transfer student?
sentences.chinese: 作为转校生，要适应这所学校困难吗？

sentences.english: Her reading has improved greatly since she changed schools.
sentences.chinese: 自从她转校以来，她的阅读水平提高了很多。

sentences.english: when i was in middle school, you transfered my shcool because you were afraid that i counld't take good care of myself.when
sentences.chinese: 在初中，怕我不会照顾自己，让我转校。

sentences.english: Most schools will accept your credits through transfer.
sentences.chinese: 在转校的时候大学校会你的原有学分。

definition: to change schools/to transfer to another college
transfer student
to quit school
to repeat a year in school
to attend school on a temporary basis
to return to school (after an interruption)/to resume one's studies
to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
to pass brilliantly (used in congratulatory fashion)
senior high school/abbr. for 高級中學|高级中学[gao1 ji2 zhong1 xue2]
to suspend schooling/to defer study
to be in the same class/to be in the same squad/classmate
school/CL:所[suo3]
to board at school
foundation of a University or College/school opening/the start of a new term
to go to school
(Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
undergraduate course of study (Tw)
